title: Usage Guidelines
subtitle: Best practices for effective machine learning with NetCraft AI

uploadData.title: Upload Your Data
uploadData.description: Start by uploading a CSV file with your dataset. The system will automatically detect column types and provide data statistics.

exploreData.title: Explore Your Data
exploreData.description: Review the data preview, column statistics, and select relevant features for your analysis.

chooseAnalysis.title: Choose Your Analysis
chooseAnalysis.description: Select from neural networks, random forest, clustering, or time series forecasting based on your data and objectives.

dataPreparation.title: Data Preparation
dataPreparation.cleanData: Clean Data: Remove or handle missing values before upload
dataPreparation.numericFeatures: Numeric Features: Ensure input features are numeric for best results
dataPreparation.scaleConsideration: Scale Consideration: Features with similar scales often work better
dataPreparation.sampleSize: Sample Size: Aim for at least 100+ samples for reliable training

architectureSelection.title: Architecture Selection
architectureSelection.startSimple: Start Simple: Begin with 1-2 hidden layers
architectureSelection.layerSize: Layer Size: Use 5-50 neurons per layer initially
architectureSelection.activationFunctions: Activation Functions: ReLU works well for most cases
architectureSelection.outputLayer: Output Layer: 1 neuron for regression, multiple for classification

trainingParameters.title: Training Parameters
trainingParameters.learningRate: Learning Rate: Start with 0.01, adjust if needed (0.001-0.1)
trainingParameters.batchSize: Batch Size: Use 16-64 for small datasets, 32 is often good
trainingParameters.monitorTraining: Monitor Training: Watch for overfitting in loss curves

dataPreparation.title: Data Preparation
dataPreparation.mixedDataTypes: Mixed Data Types: Handles both numeric and categorical features well
dataPreparation.missingValues: Missing Values: Can handle some missing data, but clean data is better
dataPreparation.featureSelection: Feature Selection: Include all potentially relevant features initially
dataPreparation.sampleSize: Sample Size: Works well with 200+ samples for reliable results

modelConfiguration.title: Model Configuration
modelConfiguration.numberOfTrees: Number of Trees: Start with 50-100 trees, increase if needed
modelConfiguration.maxDepth: Max Depth: Use 5-15 levels to balance complexity and overfitting
modelConfiguration.minSamplesSplit: Min Samples Split: 2-10 samples to control tree growth
modelConfiguration.featureSampling: Feature Sampling: Use sqrt(features) for classification tasks

performanceOptimization.title: Performance Optimization
performanceOptimization.featureImportance: Feature Importance: Use built-in feature ranking to identify key variables
performanceOptimization.crossValidation: Cross-Validation: Monitor out-of-bag error for model validation
performanceOptimization.ensembleSize: Ensemble Size: More trees generally improve accuracy but increase computation
performanceOptimization.interpretability: Interpretability: Analyze feature importance and decision paths

featureSelection.title: Feature Selection
featureSelection.relevantFeatures: Relevant Features: Choose features that define similarity
featureSelection.numericOnly: Numeric Only: Use numeric features for distance calculations
featureSelection.featureScaling: Feature Scaling: Consider if features have very different scales
featureSelection.dimensionality: Dimensionality: 2-10 features often work well for visualization

kmeansGuidelines.title: K-Means Guidelines
kmeansGuidelines.numberOfClusters: Number of Clusters: Start with 2-5 clusters
kmeansGuidelines.dataShape: Data Shape: Works best with spherical cluster shapes
kmeansGuidelines.evaluation: Evaluation: Lower inertia generally indicates better clustering

som.title: Self-Organizing Maps
som.gridSize: Grid Size: Start with 5x5 or 10x10 grids
som.trainingEpochs: Training Epochs: Use 100-1000 epochs for convergence
som.learningRate: Learning Rate: 0.1-0.5 works well for most cases
som.topology: Topology: Rectangular topology is simpler to interpret

dataRequirements.title: Data Requirements
dataRequirements.timeColumn: Time Column: Include a datetime column for proper time ordering
dataRequirements.regularIntervals: Regular Intervals: Data should have consistent time intervals (daily, weekly, etc.)
dataRequirements.sufficientHistory: Sufficient History: Use at least 20-50 time points for reliable forecasts
dataRequirements.dataQuality: Data Quality: Handle missing values and outliers before forecasting

algorithmSelection.title: Algorithm Selection
algorithmSelection.movingAverage: Moving Average: Good for stable data with minimal trend
algorithmSelection.exponentialSmoothing: Exponential Smoothing: Handles trends and seasonal patterns well
algorithmSelection.linearTrend: Linear Trend: Suitable for data with clear linear progression
algorithmSelection.combination: Combination: Compare multiple methods for best results

validationAndTuning.title: Validation and Tuning
validationAndTuning.trainTestSplit: Train-Test Split: Use 70-80% for training, rest for validation
validationAndTuning.forecastHorizon: Forecast Horizon: Start with short-term forecasts (1-10 periods)
validationAndTuning.errorMetrics: Error Metrics: Monitor MAE, RMSE, and MAPE for accuracy assessment
validationAndTuning.seasonality: Seasonality: Consider seasonal patterns in your data and algorithm choice

trainingIssues.title: Training Issues
trainingIssues.lossNotDecreasing: Loss not decreasing: Try lower learning rate or more epochs
trainingIssues.trainingTooSlow: Training too slow: Reduce network size or batch size
trainingIssues.poorAccuracy: Poor accuracy: Check data quality and feature selection

randomForestIssues.title: Random Forest Issues
randomForestIssues.overfitting: Overfitting: Reduce max depth or increase min samples split
randomForestIssues.poorPerformance: Poor performance: Increase number of trees or check feature quality
randomForestIssues.slowTraining: Slow training: Reduce number of trees or max depth

clusteringIssues.title: Clustering Issues
clusteringIssues.poorClusters: Poor clusters: Try different number of clusters or features
clusteringIssues.noClearPatterns: No clear patterns: Data might not have natural clusters
clusteringIssues.somNotConverging: SOM not converging: Increase epochs or adjust learning rate

forecastingIssues.title: Forecasting Issues
forecastingIssues.poorAccuracy: Poor accuracy: Try different algorithms or increase historical data
forecastingIssues.unstableForecasts: Unstable forecasts: Check for outliers and data quality
forecastingIssues.noTrendCaptured: No trend captured: Use exponential smoothing or linear trend methods

dataIssues.title: Data Issues
dataIssues.uploadFails: Upload fails: Check file format and size
dataIssues.wrongDataTypes: Wrong data types: Manually verify column types
dataIssues.missingValues: Missing values: Clean data before upload
